intro: Schoepfia obliquifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schoepfia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and stamens that are longer than the petals. Schoepfia obliquifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
